author: gregthegreek
content: hey! I've been slightly out of the loop regarding phase 2 architecture. Is the possibility of having custom wasm blobs totally off the table, and is it purely due to speed issues surrounding BLS on an interpreter ?

author: cdetrio
content: <@322222239850168331> who said there were speed issues with BLS on an interpreter? ü§®

author: gregthegreek
content: What was the reason for the change in direction

author: axic3354
content: I don't think there was a change in direction.

author: gregthegreek
content: Are there still going to be EE's?

author: axic3354
content:
Please define what EE means üòâ

People have widely different understanding what they are and this makes communication rather hard, at least for me to be able to say yes or no to "will EEs exist".

author: gregthegreek
content: like eth1x64 looks to be a replacement to previous ewasm research

author: axic3354
content: Eth1x64, perhaps not clearly enough, but stated that it only serves as a tool to reason and explain designs on a much smaller scale and to engage dapp developers much more earlier for feedback.

author: axic3354
content: We still plan to work on a design next with wasm and bigger changes than what eth1x64 permits. Want to compare these approaches.

author: axic3354
content: Also think that results from account abstraction will have a significant impact on this, so would be wise to take that into account before making a material decision on phase2.
